Text: Friday Files Online news analysis data features and contacts for the electronic media distribution industry from wwwadvancedtelevisioncom More Firsts at CASBAA Exciting elements in the CASBAA Convention agenda include the introduction of two breakout sessions and a delegateonly lunch and breakfast events The preconference interactive TV iTV session on November at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre considers the impact of iTV in Asia Sponsored by Boeing Space Systems the satellite breakout session on Day of the convention looks at the satellite operators response to the challenges posed by convergent media For CASBAA delegates exclusively lunch on Day November focuses on the prospects for Pay TV in China in Hosted by CASBAA Director JeanneMarie Gescher President of Beijingbased consultancy Claydon Gescher and Associates speakers include Bruno Wu Executive Chairman Sun Television Cybernetworks Holdings and Hans Hawinkels Director and CEO MIH Asia Day November of the convention starts with the Korean Investors Breakfast hosted by Simon Dewhurst of Credit Lyonnais Securities and guests include Jaehong Lew President Korean Cable TV System Operator Council Building on its popularity at CASBAA the Strategic Forum is the core conference event Ten hours of highlevel debates will be broadcast live from Asias World City Hong Kong Postconvention events November include the CASBAA Charity Golf Day on at Hong Kongs prestigious Shek O Golf and Country Club plus the Asia Pacific broadcasting industry party of the year the CASBAA Ball For conference agenda information and registration details visit wwwcasbaacom or contact mailto FRIDAY FILE th November If this is your first Friday File you have been sent this enewsletter because you have attended a trade show in the media industry and agreed to receive further information Please take a minute to complete our FREE REGISTRATION DCGIRegister to ensure that you continue to receive Friday Files from advancedtelevisioncom If this information is not relevant to you please see details at bottom of the page to unsubscribe You are also invited to click here pagespagesbprivfirsthtml to receive a Satellite may merge pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml By Sotires Eleftheriou Interviewed on Frances LCI TFs news channel the President of Canal Plus Pierre Lescure revealed that a merger between Canal Plus the analogue terrestrial premium channel with million subscribers and Canal Satellite the digital satellite bouquet with million subscribers in which Canal Plus is the main shareholder alongside Lagardere is on the cards more pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtmlLiberty buys Telecolumbus pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml By Dieter BrockmeyerATV London As expected Liberty Media in Germany is taking over the countrys number three cable operator Telecolumbus and its million subscribers The former owner db investor a subsidiary company of Deutsche Bank AG is to receive about an per cent stake in the new German cable holding company Liberty Kabel Deutschland This company will be founded after completion of buying the six regional cable systems pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtmlmore pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml Shanghai Jade Pearl Internet pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml By Owen Hughes Television Broadcasts Hong Kongs largest broadcaster has formed a joint venture in Chinas secondlargest city Shanghai to provide broadband content The venture called Shanghai Jade Pearl Internet Technologies is aimed at Shanghais broadband users a total that is expected to double in more pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml Singer supports BBCITV digitisation pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml UK cableco Telewest Communications reported a per cent rise on its shares by the close on Wednesday after improved thirdquarter core earnings up per cent and indications that it was starting to reap the benefits of bundling services together This is its fifth consecutive quarter of financial and customer growth more pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml UPC strategy revised pagespagesbnewsarchiveNovemberhtml Dutch cable group United PanEurope Communications saw a per cent fall in its share price on Wednesday later closing just per cent down at E following the announcement that the company was in negative equity to the sum of E million
